reviews.text: We arrived at the hostel at around 6pm on the 5th of September, so this review is very recent! We were welcomed by two staff members, foreign girls, which was to be a theme of our 2 night stay- not many Irish people around! They were pleasant though and we paid up front, pretty cheap for the excellent location. The bar downstairs was rammed all day it seemed, and although this was a good thing for the drinkers, it was a bad thing trying to sleep at night. We were in room 6, directly above the outdoor smoking area, and it was so noisy until closing time (around 3am). I suggest ear plugs or a radio if you want to drown out the singing/shouting/etc from downstairs. Maybe we were unlucky with the position of our room, but it was very very loud. The room itself was basic but clean, one bunkbed, a clean nice bathroom with a good shower. No towels, but we had brought our own, not expecting towels to be provided. Breakfast, served from 8-10am was OK, just the usual toast/cereal really, nothing special. The location of this hotel is superb though, right in the middle of the packed Temple Bar area and you're close to everything really. If you can put up with the horrendous noise (i.e if you're out until 4am anyway) then this would be fine, but I wouldn't recommend it if you're not out that late, and certainly not recommended for families with young children!
reviews.title: Good but very noisy!

reviews.text: The appartments provide Excellent "value for money" in Temple Bar on the very top floor of Oliver St John Gogerty buildings. However ,the clue lies that there are various rooms/"Back-packer" Dormotories on the middle floors and at 185 Euros a night don't confuse a bargain with what is essentially a clean, though relatively basic two bedroom apartment . The kitchen was well equiped, although the cooker had not been cleaned since the last occupier. The lounge had satalite TV , however almost half the light bulbs had failed and not been replaced and the curtains were mostly in need of a wash or were torn.
reviews.title: Hostle Standard Appartments

likes.disliked: — The place needed maintenance and looked tired

reviews.text: The noise from the street wasn't too bad, however the appartment had a hostel feel about it and looked distinctly tired at the end of the holiday season and ready for some much needed TLC
reviews.title: Great Location - Apartment and Staff Awful!

reviews.text: We have just returned from birthday celbration weekend in Dublin and stayed in Gogarty's Penthouse Apartments. We(6 girls) arrived late Friday night to be told that they only had booking for 5 - night porter very unhelpful and the fact he was Polish didnt help.We were told we'd have to leave if we didnt pay again the next morning but he would "allow" us to stay for that night! Had to beg an extra bed after arguing that we were in the right as i had copy emails to confirm. When we went to go to bed we discovered one bed had no mattress!down the stairs we went again.
reviews.title: Excellent place - recommend it to anyone

reviews.text: In the morning we went and had to explain ourselves several times to the receptionist(also foreign) who in the end said she could see we had paid an extra 100 euros and would have to take our word that it was for another bed! Well, it certainly wasn't a tip!!
reviews.title: "Horses for Courses"

likes.liked: — Excellent position at a good price

reviews.text: Great clean rooms.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: only quibbles are the noise but thats par for the course in that area of Dublin, the rooms got very hot and that there weren't enough key card things for the room with alot of people sharing.
reviews.title: Basic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hostel though one of the best I have been in.
reviews.title: Location a plus, but everything else....

reviews.text: A group of 8 of us stayed at this hostel for one night. The rooms were basic but clean. The perfect place to stay if you're going for a night out.
reviews.title: Very Basic

reviews.text: If you're planning to party till 3am then this is the place for you. Otherwise sleeping was incredibly difficult. The amount of noise that echoed in from the downstairs bar was sometimes completely unbelievable. Singing and chanting would be heard nightly to the wee hours of the morning, then before 8am the sound of metal tables being dragged across the cobble stone floor was akin to a horse hooves against a chalkboard. The staff was quite odd and never seemed to get the price of the stay right with any of the guests (tried to double charge us). There was no locker storage, only tiny "safe deposit boxes" for those interested in keeping anything safe (for a fee). The mattress was so thin that feeling the metal frame through it was a given and there were burn holes throughout all of my bedding. It was maybe one of the worst hostels I've ever stayed in (and I've probably been to about 100 in my life). On the bright side, the pub downstairs was one of my favourites in all of Dublin with various different rooms and music and it was a happening place every nite of the week (hence noise being a given). Next time I'd probably try the Barnacles down the road also in the Temple bar district.
reviews.title: Basic but ideal location

likes.disliked: — The main areas of the hotel could do with an update

reviews.text: Me and 3 friends stayed in the penthouse apartments here for two nights. We did not feel like we were staying in a hostel at all, everything was clean, tidy and the views from our roof terrace were great. The best thing is you are right in the centre for temple bar and all the attractions and shops, and a short stagger home from the pubs! Will def do this again!
reviews.title: Penthouse apartments are fab!

likes.liked: — having private roof terrace, great location.

reviews.text: If you fancy a change from all the traditional irish bars while you are there, pop into the morgan hotel near the hostel, it has a gorgeous bar serving delicious cocktails.
reviews.title: Fab Holiday

reviews.text: Hostal was very clean, good private room. Wasn't as noisy as I would expect at temple bar, good comfy bed and hot showers. Good breakfast, nice people. But couldn't find Tv room and although on the last night someone tried to get into our room would def stay again.
reviews.title: Good times in Dublin

likes.disliked: — some of the people I share a bathroom with were not clean, no fault of the hostel

reviews.text: Leanne & Cathy Scotland
reviews.title: Nice historic building - incredibly clean rooms

likes.disliked: — ease of access for luggage (there are lifts, but it's an old building with LOTS of doorways)

reviews.text: Great location, basic clean rooms. Nice staff.
reviews.title: Not bad, not great

reviews.text: We ( a group of 9 girls...average age about 22) stayed at Gogartys for one night on March 26th and we would highly recommend it for a short trip to Dublin.
reviews.title: Ah go on go on go on...

reviews.text: The Location is spot on with everything close at hand. Yeah it might be a little noisy in the early hours but thats really not a big deal for a short trip.
reviews.title: In the heart of Temple Bar

reviews.text: The room (we had a 10 bed dorm) was brilliant and if a group of nine girls can all manage to get ready and stay pretty organised...that i'm sure just about anyone can!
reviews.title: It was OK

reviews.text: The brekkie was cereal, toast, juice, fruit and hot drinks, pretty standard but did us just fine and you could eat as much of it as you liked.
reviews.title: They say it's all in the 'Location Location Location'!

reviews.text: We would definately recommend the Backpaker Beer Crawl. at 8 euros each you get a guided tour of about 5 bars, drinks offers and a couple of free shots. It doesnt take you around Temple bar so you find some really great pubs, full of locals and students, that you probably wouldn't consider/find on your own. So it's definately worth doing!
reviews.title: In the heart of the action
